danish_publication: Der boede en gårdmand i Åsum ved Odense, han tjente i sine unge dage som karl et sted i byen, og i den samme gård var også en stor dreng. Så en Mortensaften siger karlen til drengen, om han vilde tjene penge. Ja, det vilde jo drengen nok. Så skulde han have 8 sk. for at gå hen til kirken og løbe tre gange rundt om den og hver gang råbe indad nøglehullet: "Jeg vil høre Fanden til!" Da han kom til dören tredje gang, kom der en hvid skikkelse, som der stod ild ud af munden på. Det var jo karlen, der havde fået et lagen over sig og noget trøske i munden. Drengen fik ikke råbt tredje gang, men gik fra forstanden over det.
english_publication: There was a farmer in Åsum near Odense, he had worked in his youth as a farmhand in the town, and in the same farm there was also a big hired boy. Then one Mortens eve the farmhand asks the boy if he wants to earn some money. Yes, the boy wanted to. Then he’d get eight shillings if he’d go to the church and run around it three times and each time yell into the keyhole, “I want to belong to the devil!” When he got to the door the third time, a white form with fire coming out of its mouth appeared. It was the farmhand who had put a sheet over himself and some rotted wood in his mouth. The boy didn’t yell the third time, but went crazy from the experience.
